page.p:
Under the Asset Management Mandate, THE CLIENT entrusts SCAMC with the discretionary
Management of his assets, within the scope of articles 3 and 4 hereafter.

Within the scope of his discretionary mandate, SCAMC is authorised, without being obliged, to undertake all ordinary banking transactions, such as defined under the "Portfolio Management Guidelines" of the Swiss Bankers Association(SBA). All modifications of these Guidelines in respect to the ordinary banking transactions will automatically be applicable to the present agreement.

By ordinary banking transactions, in the sense of these Guidelines, we mainly understand fixed time deposits and fiduciary deposits, transactions in precious metals, investments in securities in the monetary and capital markets, such as shares, bonds,notes,certificates of deposits etc.,as well as investments funds, investment companies and other public investment instruments.

Furthermore, SCAMC is authorised, without being obliged, to initiate transactions in derivatives and to invest in non-traditional investments, within the limits fixed by the Guidelines of the SBA, regarding the asset management mandate.

SCAMC is also authorised to take all necessary administrative steps which are necessary for the good conduct of his mandate. Within this scope, SCAMC will take all the decisions in the CLIENT'S interest.
Finally, SCAMC is authorised to pledge THE CLIENT'S assets for guarantee reasons.
Under the investment counselling mandate, SCAMC commits itself to supply THE CLIENT, within the context of his (their) portfolio(s) mentioned under article 1, with investment recommendations.
THE CLIENT may not follow these recommendations and remain free to choose the investments. The final decision relating to them falls exclusively to him.

Within the scope of the investment counselling mandate SCAMC commits itself to the utmost necessary diligence in the selection and formulation of the recommendations to THE CLIENT

THE CLIENT confirms having been informed by SCAMC of the inherent risks of investments and/or of envisaged investments. THE CLIENT is also aware of the fact, that looking for higher results implies an increase of risk; that can in some extreme cases-lead to the loss of invested capital

THE CLIENT can at any moment give instructions to SCAMC. For instructions given by telephone or by E-mail, SCAMC has the right, but no obligation, to require a written confirmation before executing them. THE CLIENT bears the full economic risk of the execution of these instructions, even for the one which may have resulted from an error, or if it turns out that the instructions have been transmitted by fraudulence.
